intro: Anoectochilus xingrenensis, commonly known as the Xingren Orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant typically produces small, fragrant flowers with a unique coloration pattern, often featuring a combination of white, yellow, and green hues. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, typically growing on tree trunks or rocks in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
